intentSnapshot.primary_goal: Create a feature branch for implementing user authentication
secondary_goals: Ensure clean separation from main branch
intentSnapshot.context: Working on sprint ticket AUTH-123 to add OAuth integration to the application

decisionRationale.reasoning: Chose to create branch from latest main to ensure all recent changes are included. Used feature/ prefix as per team conventions.

alternatives_considered.option: Create branch from previous stable release
alternatives_considered.rejection_reason: Team policy requires feature branches from main
Against established team practices and CI/CD pipeline

what_worked: Following established naming conventions saved time
Checking out latest main first prevented conflicts
Using git command line interface provided precise control
what_didnt_work: Initial branch name didn't follow exact convention (missing ticket number)
Forgot to push branch initially, causing confusion with team

lessons_learned.lesson: Always include ticket number in branch name for better traceability
Push new branch immediately after creation to make it visible to team
Double-check branch naming convention before finalizing

recommendations: Create branch naming template or script to reduce errors
Set up git hooks to remind about pushing new branches
Document branch naming conventions in team wiki
